decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to create an infinite creature combo using Midnight Guard and Presence of Gond. This is achieved by having Midnight Guard on the battlefield and then enchanting it with Presence of Gond, which creates a 1/1 Elf Warrior token. Whenever the token is created, it untaps the Midnight Guard, allowing you to repeat the process and generate an unlimited number of Elf Warrior tokens. This combo can be supported by cards like Soul Warden and Soul's Attendant, which gain life whenever a creature enters the battlefield, and cards like Cenn's Enlistment and Battle Screech, which create multiple creature tokens.

This Pauper 1 vs 1 deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay with the goal of overwhelming the opponent quickly. By utilizing cheap spells and creatures with high power/toughness ratios like Kiln Fiend and Nivix Cyclops, the deck aims to deal significant damage in a short amount of time. Protection and evasion spells like Apostle's Blessing and Artful Dodge help to ensure the creatures can get through to hit the opponent directly. The deck is designed to be efficient and lethal, putting pressure on the opponent from the very beginning of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells while also utilizing artifacts and lands for card advantage and mana fixing. The synergy between cards like Thraben Inspector, Palace Sentinels, and Glint Hawk allows for constant card draw and board presence. Using efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast, this Boros Aggro deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain board control to secure victory in a fast-paced 1 vs 1 game.

The main focus of this Pauper 1 vs 1 Aggro - Hot Dogs deck is to quickly deploy and buff up cheap creatures like Delver of Secrets, Kiln Fiend, and Nivix Cyclops to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. This is achieved by using efficient spells like Gitaxian Probe, Ponder, Preordain, Slip Through Space, and Lightning Bolt to dig for cards and protect your threats. The deck also includes cards like Temur Battle Rage, Apostle's Blessing, and Spell Pierce to ensure your creatures can connect with the opponent and maximize their damage potential.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with quick, efficient creatures and pump spells. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Young Wolf and Skarrgan Pit-Skulk alongside pump spells like Rancor and Hunger of the Howlpack, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Quirion Ranger and Nettle Sentinel help to provide additional mana and tempo advantage, allowing the deck to keep up the pressure. The inclusion of Vault Skirge and River Boa also provide resilience against removal and flying threats, making the deck a powerful force in the Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Tireless Tribe combo, using cards like Shadow Rift and Inside Out to pump up the creature's power and win the game in one big swing. It includes a lot of cantrips and cheap counterspells to protect the combo and dig for key pieces. The deck also includes some card draw and filtering to ensure consistency. The mana base is set up to support the deck's low curve and color requirements.

The main focus of this Mono Green Aggro deck is to overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and pump spells. By playing efficient creatures like Nest Invader and Burning-Tree Emissary early on, the deck aims to apply continuous pressure on the opponent. Cards like Rancor and Hunger of the Howlpack help to further boost the power of the creatures, while Vines of Vastwood provide protection. The deck also includes a few utility spells like Mutagenic Growth and Viridian Longbow to deal with various threats. Overall, the strategy revolves around fast, efficient aggression to win the game quickly.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent by playing efficient threats and disrupting their game plan with counter spells and bounce effects. By utilizing graveyard recursion with cards like Exhume and Gurmag Angler, the deck can constantly apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to help dig for key cards and maintain card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive while controlling the game tempo through disruption and efficient threats.

This deck focuses on aggressive early game plays with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Ninja of the Deep Hours, as well as disruption through cards like Spellstutter Sprite and Counterspell. It aims to maintain card advantage and tempo with card draw spells like Ponder and Gush, while also utilizing removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Skred to control the board. The mana base is designed to consistently provide the necessary colors for the spells in the deck. Overall, the deck is built to apply pressure while maintaining control of the game.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures like Firebrand Archer and Thermo-Alchemist, while also utilizing direct burn spells like Chain Lightning, Flame Rift, and Lava Spike. The deck aims to consistently apply pressure and finish off the opponent with efficient burn spells such as Fireblast, Lightning Bolt, and Rift Bolt. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Needle Drop and Searing Blaze help maintain card advantage and control the board. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and focused on winning through direct damage.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Faerie Miscreant, and Ninja of the Deep Hours, while also disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Spellstutter Sprite and Counterspell. The deck aims to control the board with efficient creatures like Spire Golem and maintain card advantage through cantrips like Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm. With a tempo-focused strategy supplemented by bounce spells like Vapor Snag and Daze, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through efficient burn spells and small creatures with pinging abilities. It includes cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning to control the board and finish off opponents, along with card draw and deck manipulation to ensure consistent threats. The goal is to maintain pressure with early creatures like Delver of Secrets and Firebrand Archer while using direct damage spells to close out the game. The deck aims to win before the opponent can stabilize or establish a dominant board presence.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to control the game by utilizing various control spells such as Counterspell, Chainer's Edict, Disfigure, and Doom Blade. The deck also focuses on card advantage and value through cards like Mulldrifter and Archaeomancer. Additionally, the deck includes flicker effects like Ghostly Flicker to reuse key creatures or gain additional value from enters-the-battlefield effects. The deck also has some graveyard recursion with cards like Reaping the Graves. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and out value the opponent in the long run.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures that are buffed by various enchantments like Ancestral Mask, Armadillo Cloak, and Ethereal Armor. By attaching multiple auras to creatures like Gladecover Scout and Slippery Bogle, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck also includes cards like Utopia Sprawl and Abundant Growth to help fix mana and ensure a smooth curve. Overall, the deck focuses on quickly building a powerful board presence and staying ahead in tempo.

The key focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage through cards like Chittering Rats and Mulldrifter. Archaeomancer allows for the recycling of key spells, while Ghostly Flicker can provide additional value by reusing enter-the-battlefield abilities. The deck also includes graveyard recursion with Reaping the Graves and Unearth, as well as card selection with Preordain and Sea Gate Oracle. The mana base is designed to support the control elements of the deck, ensuring a steady stream of spells and resources.

The main concept of this deck is to flood the board with cheap artifact creatures like Atog, Carapace Forger, and Myr Enforcer, then use cards like Thoughtcast to draw more cards and maintain card advantage. By utilizing artifacts such as Springleaf Drum, Prophetic Prism, and Chromatic Star, the deck aims to quickly assemble a powerful board presence while also having removal options with Galvanic Blast. The inclusion of cards like Fling and Temur Battle Rage offer the possibility to close out games with surprise burst damage.
